q: pm: Afternoon, Josh Halliday here taking over from Matthew Weaver. This just in: Chancellor George Osborne has been defending Andy Coulson .`` Andy Coulson did a good job as director of communications,'' he said. There was never any complaints about how he did that job- which is pretty unique when you look at the people who've done that job in the past. It was George Osborne , you might recall, who personally suggested hiring Andy Coulson in 2007 after his resignation as editor of News of the World. 2.54 pm: My colleagues James Robinson and Vikram Dodd have the " The head of the Metropolitan police said today that`` no stone will be left unturned in the fresh investigation into the News of the World phone hacking allegations announced yesterday, four years after the initial convictions in the case. An hour before Mr Andy Coulson 's announcement, during a visit to RAF Brize Norton in Mr David Cameron 's Oxfordshire constituency, the Prime Minister was asked if he still had faith in him. He said: You know what I have said about this in the past. I have got nothing to add to that and I think he's done a very good job for the Government. 1155 David Cameron has expressed his sorry at the resignation and said that Mr Andy Coulson carried his duties with the`` complete professionalism''. He said that he expects Mr Andy Coulson to continue to have a successful career

Larry Page and Sergey are 10 years older than they were when they thoughtfully hired Eric Schmidt to be the CEO... so everybody's growing up, Vint Cerf said. Google has grown over the past decade from a start-up battling other Internet search engines into a technology giant with nearly 25,000 employees and annual revenue of nearly$ 30 billion.
